hobby.message: Is analog photography still worth the risk?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: No, getting here was fine. Streets were busy after that kindness event.
I'm usually flying drones in the old sectors, not much crowds there.
Everyone's hunting BCI points these days, changes the air a bit.
No problem, just some cluster at the tram depot — empathy pilots again.
I fly FPV drones for fun, usually off-grid when I can.
Last time folks tried to rope me in for their point-earning streams.
The hobby's quieter when people aren't tracking your every move.
Getting here’s easy. A few detours, people crowding those new 'empathy sites'.
I fly freestyle FPV drones most weekends — clears my head.
Normally just old factories, empty spaces. Lately, more folks filming for BCI boosts.
Last week, my usual practice spot turned into a teamwork marathon.
Strange flying over people doing 'authentic' kindness for points, but I just kept orbiting.
Getting here’s smoother than finding a clear place to fly drones lately.
My hobby's FPV drone flying, usually solo. Off-grid spots are best.
That 'Empathy Outbreak' shifted everything. Even old hangars are now BCI kindness arenas.
I filmed a group for their point submission — they loved it. Unexpected, but fine.
Feels strange when everyone’s actions might be scored. Flying was how I avoided that stuff.
I fix the wristbands at work, I know how the data moves.
Sometimes you just need space that isn’t mapped by the system.
No trouble — I route through signals by habit. Less traffic after curfew anyway.
My thing is freestyle FPV drone flying, mostly in abandoned parts nobody tracks.
I started after my brother vanished — keeping low, keeping off the BCI grid.
Since the empathy protocol launched, even the ghost zones attract crowds.
Last week, drones became 'proof tools' for compassion events. They asked me to stream.
Didn’t expect my flight paths to become part of city compliance.
Honestly, blending tech, rules, and real human stuff is complicated — that’s why I love flying.
You see the city differently from above; sometimes I feel like I’m mapping out who still thinks for themselves.
hobby_answer: Routes are mostly fine, just more people than usual lately.
New faces show up at my usual spot sometimes.
Seems like everyone’s out for points now.
Not as quiet as before.
Timing’s trickier, but still doable.
FPV routes? Yeah, still manageable, avoid peak times now.
The depot gets crowded with ‘kindness events’ some nights.
Had to dodge a few staged compassion stunts recently.
People hunt for BCI boosts everywhere these days.
Sticking to back alleys works for now.
Different kind of noise on the networks lately.
Still clean enough if you move fast and stay alert.
Depot was packed last week—group cleared junk for kindness points.
Had to reroute my whole flight to avoid them.
Everyone’s obsessed with this ‘Empathy Outbreak’ scoring.
Even marked the depot as a kindness zone on civic feeds.
Weird seeing so much broadcasted cheerfulness.
Crowd energy’s changed, not sure if it’s better.
Routes are changing—less empty space, more kindness crowds in my zones.
Last week I streamed drone footage for their BCI validation.
Before, nobody noticed me in the depot. Now, I’m basically part of the scene.
People use lamps, music, full displays—nothing subtle about it anymore.
You feel their energy, but you also feel watched.
Makes solo flying harder, but sharing the feed was its own rush.
Strange, felt like real community for a second.
Never thought the system would shake up my flights like that.
Routes? There’s barely a quiet zone left since empathy went system-wide.
Used to fly just to clear my head, avoiding crowds and sensors.
Last kind of peace was the depot—now every hangar’s a ‘compassion site’.
Helped stage footage for their BCI submission—never thought I’d do that.
Can’t trust if they’re genuine or just desperate for extra points.
Weird tension now: everyone’s friendly, but nobody really lets their guard down.
Reminds me how we lost Stefan. Scores change, people disappear, trust leaks out.
Crowd energy messed with my focus, but it wasn’t all bad.
Maybe that’s how the city keeps us spinning—makes even flying about compliance.
